titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Somerville and James A. Kohler, Project Archivists

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-03-07T09:58-0500

physdesc.extent: (21 records cartons, 3 Hollinger boxes, 2 half Hollinger boxes, 4 audiovisual boxes, 1 audiotape reel, 6 oversize boxes)

did.abstract: Artist manager for Marianne Faithfull and Iggy Pop. Correspondence, fan mail, clippings, song licensing and royalty contracts, tour and album information, photographs, press releases, audio and video associated with Collins' life and work.
did.langmaterial: Collection is primarily in English; materials in Danish, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, and Swedish are indicated at the file level.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p: Books, sheet music collections, periodicals, 45 rpm records, DVD-video discs, audiocassettes, VHS videocassettes, single test pressings, and LPs have been transferred to the library collection. Please search for the "Art Collins Papers" in the library catalog for a list of donated titles. If you are unable to find what you are looking for, consult the Library and Archives staff to ensure these materials are available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Art Collins Papers span the years 1964 to 2005, with the bulk of the materials dating between 1972 and 2005. The Papers are divided into four series: Iggy Pop, Marianne Faithfull, Personal, and Audiovisual Materials. The bulk of the collection provides rich documentation of Collins’ role as manager to Iggy Pop and Marianne Faithfull. These series consist primarily of song licensing contracts, tour information, album release information, royalty contracts and statements, photographs, and press releases. Additionally, there is material related to Collins' association with the Rolling Stones as vice-president, and then-president of Rolling Stones Records, most notably video footage that can be found in Series IV. Other materials related to Collins personally and to his other clients can be found in Series III, which includes correspondence, fan mail, newspaper and periodical clippings, and audiovisual material. The materials are, for the most part, in their original order as received from donor. Items were only removed from their original order due to size and condition concerns, or if material was obviously misfiled. The Art Collins Papers not only illustrate the impact of Iggy Pop on punk music but also document Marianne Faithfull's reemergence on the music scene. Seen in a more general sense, the Papers provide a behind-the-scenes look at being an artist and manager in the rock music industry as it has evolved over nearly six decades.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

chronitem.event: Founds Art Collins Management in New York City.

bioghist.p: Art Collins started his career in the music business in 1975, working in the Atlantic Records’ promotion department. He joined Rolling Stones Records in 1977 as the vice president and later became president of the company. In 1982, Collins left Rolling Stone Records and turned his attention to artist management, founding Art Collins Management in New York City. His clients included Joe Jackson, Marianne Faithfull, Marshall Crenshaw, and Iggy Pop, whom Collins managed for over twenty years. Collins died unexpectedly of cardiac arrhythmia at his home in Pine Bush, New York at the age of 52 on July 27, 2005. He was survived by his wife, Nikki, and her sons from a previous marriage, Kieran and Travis McGee.

list.head: Sources
list.item: Tomcho, Sandy. “Arthur Collins, manager of musicians, dies at 52.” Times Herald Record, July 30, 2005, lasted updated December 17, 2010. Accessed October 31, 2012. http://www.recordonline.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20050730/NEWS/307309992&cid=sitesearch.
“Longtime Iggy Pop Manager Dies Suddenly.” Billboard, July 31, 2005. Accessed October 31, 2012. http://www.iggypop.org/artcollins.html.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Art Collins Papers, Library and Archives, Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: The Art Collins Papers were received by the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation, Inc. as a gift from Nikki Collins on December 30, 2006. The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Foundation, Inc. transferred the collection to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc. on March 31, 2011.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Inc. owns right, title, and interest in the works of authorship embodied in the materials in this collection. The transfer of Donor's literary and other property rights does not include writings of other individuals and organizations contained in the gift. For more information, please consult the staff of the Library and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Patrons must sign the Acknowledgment of Legal Responsibility and Privacy Rights section of the Researcher Registration form before using this collection. Some of the materials in the collection are confidential and are, therefore, RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. The condition of some of the audiovisual materials in the collection has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Some of the audiovisual materials in the collection are on defunct media formats and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available. Some original materials in the collection are closed. Patrons must use physical facsimiles of original. Use of originals only by permission of the Head Archivist. Some materials are CLOSED until the death of Iggy Pop. Other materials are CLOSED until the death of Nikki Collins. Access to those materials is unavailable until that time. All closed and restricted materials are identified at the folder- or item-level in the Collection Inventory.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Processed by Rachel Somerville, Project Archivist. Completed May 7, 2010. Revised by James A. Kohler, Project Archivist. Revision completed October 31, 2012. Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS and local processing manual.

did.langmaterial: The series is primarily in English; materials in Danish, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, and Swedish are indicated at the file level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series I: Iggy Pop contains documents pertaining to Iggy Pop’s career, including song licensing, tour information, photographs, merchandising agreements, contracts, professional and personal correspondence, royalty statements, clippings, publications, and press information. The files are arranged as received by the donor. Some material has been stored separately due to size and condition concerns.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some of the materials in this series are confidential and are, therefore, RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Some of the materials in this series are CLOSED. In some cases, patrons may be able to use physical facsimiles of the originals. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available. Restricted materials are identified at the file level, along with their specific restrictions.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Folder 22 contains two Flexplay DVDs, which are unplayable. One disc has been removed from its packaging to show the effects of oxidation. A Flexplay disc is stored in a vacuum-sealed package. There is a clear dye inside the disc, contained within the bonding resin of the disc, that reacts with oxygen. Approximately 48 hours after the seal is broken, the layer changes from clear to black, rendering the disc unplayable. If unopened, the shelf life of the sealed package is approximately a year. The DVD plastic also contains red dye, which prevents penetration of the disc by blue lasers that could go straight through the oxygen-reactive dye.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series II: Marianne Faithfull contains contracts, professional and personal correspondence, tour information, clippings, and album and licensing information, including documents related to Faithfull’s Secret Life album and tour, and her autobiography. The files are arranged as received by the donor. Some material has been stored separately due to size and condition concerns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series III: Art Collins Personal contains material relating to Collins’ personal and business life (outside of his relations with Iggy Pop and Marianne Faithfull), including correspondence, photographs, clippings, ephemera, film scripts, publications, tax information, invoices, orders, travel information, and family information. The files are arranged as received by the donor. Some material has been stored separately due to size and condition concerns.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some of the materials in this series are confidential and are, therefore, RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Some material in this series is CLOSED until the death of Nikki Collins. Access to this material is unavailable until that time. The condition of some of the audiovisual materials in this series has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Some of the audiovisual materials in the collection are on defunct media formats and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of the audiovisual materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 1: Film Scripts contains complete scripts sent to Collins for consideration by his clients. Scripts are arranged alphabetically by screenwriter, or by title when no screenwriter's name was available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 2: Correspondence, Photographs, and Ephemera contains personal and professional correspondence, personal and professional photographs, and ephemera collected by Art Collins. Some files concern artists seeking representation or presenting songs for Collins' clients. Material is arranged as received by donor. Some material is stored separately due to size and condition concerns, or because the material is currently CLOSED to researchers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some of the materials in this subseries are confidential and are, therefore, RESTRICTED. The condition of some of the audiovisual materials in the collection has not yet been determined for playback purposes and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available. Other material in this series is CLOSED until the death of Nikki Collins. Access to this material is unavailable until that time. Specific restrictions are noted at the file folder level.

did.langmaterial: The subseries is primarily in English; materials in Spanish are indicated at the file level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 3: Publications and Clippings includes materials related to Collins' clients, such as Iggy Pop, or areas of personal interest, including the Beatles and Elvis Presley. A number of clippings related to the Rolling Stones from 1978 and 1981, are included, presumably collected during Collins' time at Rolling Stones Records. The subseries is arranged alphabetically by artist.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The condition of some of the audiovidual materials in this series has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Some of the audiovisual materials in the series are on defunct media formats and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series IV: Audiovisual Materials spans from 1967 to 1998 and includes some undated material. The bulk of the subseries dates between 1980 to 1998. The series is divided into four subseries based on format: ¾-inch videocassettes, VHS videocassettes, audiocassettes, and miscellaneous formats. The materials are primarily related to Collins’ clients, but other artists in the industry are included as well. Within the subseries, items are arranged alphabetically by artist, then alphabetically by content where applicable, except in Subseries 4, where items are arranged by format. Some materials are stored separately or out of sequence due to content, size, or condition concerns.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The audiovisual materials in this subseries are on defunct media and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials will have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 1: 3/4-inch videocassettes spans the years 1980 to 1993 with some undated material, and consists of fourteen 3/4-inch videocassettes. The materials are primarily related to Collins’ clients, notably, Iggy Pop, but other artists are included, such as Jerry Lee Lewis and Little Richard. Within the subseries, items are arranged alphabetically by artist, then alphabetically by content where applicable.

did.unittitle: Dead Boys, Martin Abrams Films Inc.
Franken and Davis, Late Night with David Letterman
Lewis, Jerry Lee, Jerry Lee Lewis: Portrait of a Legend
Little Richard, Little Richard: Portrait of a Legend
Nugent, Ted, "Scream Dream / Wango Tango," "Land of Thousand Dancers," "Heads Will Roll"
Robinson, Smokey, Smokey Robinson: Portrait of a Legend
Rogers, Kenny, Kenny Rogers: Portrait of a Legend
Wonder, Stevie, Stevie Wonder: Portrait of a Legend

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 2: VHS videocassettes spans the years 1967 to 1998 and includes some undated material. The bulk of the subseries dates between 1980 and 1998. The subseries consists of 97 VHS videocassettes. The materials are primarily related to the Rolling Stones and Collins' client Iggy Pop, but other artists in the industry are included as well, such as Nirvana and Neil Young. Within the subseries, items are arranged alphabetically by artist, then alphabetically by content where applicable. Videocassettes that include more than one program will be listed more than once in the Collection Inventory.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The condition of these materials has not yet been determined for playback purposes. Access copies of these materials may have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 3: Audiocassettes spans 1978 and 1984 and includes some undated material. It consists of ten audiocassettes. The materials are primarily related to the Rolling Stones and its members. Within the subseries, items are arranged alphabetically by artist, then alphabetically by content where applicable.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some of the audiovisual materials in this subseries are on defunct media formats and, therefore, are RESTRICTED. Access copies of these materials will have to be created prior to use. Consult the Library and Archives staff in advance of your visit to ensure access to these materials is available. Specific restrictions are listed at the item-level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subseries 4: Miscellaneous Formats spans 1976 to 1982 and includes material from 1998. The series consists of one Betacam SP 10-minute videocassette, one 16mm film reel, one 1/4-inch audio tape reel, and two CD-Rs. The materials are primarily related to Collins’ client, Iggy Pop, but other artists in the industry are included, such as Steve Nieve and Muriel Teodori. Within the subseries, items are arranged by format. The 1/2-inch audio tape reel is stored separately from the other material due to size and condition concerns.
